Text: A non-vector party damaged an underground or overhead electricity cable

A vehicle hit a ground mounted substation.
A third party has caused lines to come down. If it is the result of a pole being hit select subtype Car v Pole
A close approach permit is required to work near Vector lines.
The FSP reports earths are missing
Shoes are observed hanging over the power lines
FSP to visit and bridge hot water relay.
Customer reports that there is no hot water at premise
Hot water pilot line has faulted causing a loss of hot water. Northern network only.
Reported by EOC
Reported by EOC

A customer has reported a tree touching lines causing sparking, or lines are touching the tree causing the tree to conduct electricity or the tree has grown in a way someone could climb the tree and touch the lines.
Reported by EOC or as the result of a roll up

A customer has a general safety concern that is not covered by any other request sub type
A pillar has been reported as damaged and no 3rd party  is seen causing the damage
A pillar has been reported as damaged and no 3rd party  is seen causing the damage
A pole has been reported as damaged and no 3rd party  is seen causing the damage
Customer has experienced an electric shock

An urgent disconnection is requested by EOC, emergency services[1]
Sparks have been reported.

A zone substation fault requires a Faultman to attend
A customer has requested a temporary disconnection[2]
A customer has requested a reconnection.  This should be a child request of the disconnection or related fault SR

Only to be used as an outcome of an initial fault investigation
Only to be used as an outcome of an initial fault investigation

A streetlight is not turning off during the day
Generally used as part of a Roll-up

A retailer has requested Vector identify and tag a fuse in a pillar/pit.
